s:subsection.s:paragraph: The project can be compiled and installed with Maven:

The project contains optional modules that will only run on Android. These modules are not built by default. In order to instruct Maven to build the optional modules, the io7m-android-build profile should be enabled:
This profile can be enabled permanently by adding it to your Maven settings.xml:

Additionally, the ANDROID_HOME environment variable must be set to the path of the system's Android SDK, and both $ANDROID_HOME/tools and $ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools must be present in your environment's PATH variable. Internally, the build system uses the maven-android-plugin with entirely default settings, so the documentation on the plugin should be consulted in the case of Android-related build issues.

The project contains unit tests that will optionally be executed if the io7m-android-test profile is enabled. This requires use of either the AVD emulator, or a real Android device. The device named by the android.device property is the one that will be used by the test suite:

As per the documentation on the Maven Android plugin, the android.device property may be set to usb if there is exactly one device attached via USB, emulator if there is exactly one emulated device running, or the name of a specific device, emulated or otherwise.

All io7m.com packages use Semantic Versioning
http://semver.org , which implies that it is always safe to use version ranges with an exclusive upper bound equal to the next major version - the API of the package will not change in a backwards-incompatible manner before the next major version.

s:section.s:paragraph: There are currently no known platform-specific issues.
